wikitext.*:
'''''saur''''' is a [[Sindarin]] word meaning "bad", used in the sense "bad of food" and "putrid".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, pp. 183-4</ref>
==Etymology==
*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[SAWA]]<ref name=PE17/>
==Examples==
[[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] suggested that the name ''[[Sauron#Etymology|Sauron]]'' could be "a genuine Sindarin formation from ''saur''", but stated that the name is "probably from [[Quenya]]".<ref name=PE17/>
==Cognates==
*[[Quenya]] ''[[saura]]''
